title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.107 - Petition; filing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.107 - Petition; filing

State Regulations
(a) Filing of petition. Any labor organization or employer may file with the
director of PEPR electronically (see section
263.15
of this Part) a petition
for a declaratory ruling with respect to the scope of negotiations under FLFLPA
and SERA. The petition shall be in writing on a form provided by the director
of PEPR and shall be supported by a declaration of the filer. (b) Contents of petition. The petition shall
include the following: (1)
the name, address
and affiliation, if any, of the petitioner, and the title of any representative
filing the petition; (2)
a complete
statement of the relevant facts and the grounds prompting the petition, including a full disclosure of the petitioner's interest; (3)
the names and addresses of any other
persons, labor organizations or employers whose interests are reasonably likely
to be affected by the ruling; and
(4)
at the option of the petitioner, a
proposed ruling. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
263.107

Adopted

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
